intro: Polystachya glaberrima, commonly known as the glabrous spikegrass, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Ghana. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit and produces tall, erect stems with whorled leaves. Its inflorescence consists of multiple racemes bearing small, greenish-white flowers. Polystachya glaberrima is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
